t: Thus*pn says the Lord:*s “Keep*ln justice, and do righteousness, for*ln soon my salvation will come, and*ld my righteousness be revealed.
Blessed*ln is the man who does this, and*ld the son of man who holds it fast, who*ln keeps the Sabbath, not profaning it, and*ld keeps his hand from doing any evil.”
Let*pn not the foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord*s say, “The*ld Lord*s will surely separate me from his people”; and*ln let not the eunuch say, “Behold,*ld I am a dry tree.”
For*ln thus says the Lord:*s “To*ln the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, who*ld choose the things that please me and*ld hold fast my covenant,
I*ln will give in my house and within my walls a*ld monument and a name better*ld than sons and daughters; I*ln will give them an everlasting name that*ld shall not be cut off.

“And*pn the foreigners who join themselves to the Lord,*s to*ld minister to him, to love the name of the Lord,*s and*ld to be his servants, everyone*ln who keeps the Sabbath and does not profane it, and*ld holds fast my covenant—

these*ln I will bring to my holy mountain, and*ld make them joyful in my house of prayer; their*ln burnt offerings and their sacrifices will*ld be accepted on my altar; for*ln my house shall be called a house of prayer for*ld all peoples.”
The*ln Lord God,*s who*ld gathers the outcasts of Israel, declares, “I*ln will gather yet others to him besides*ld those already gathered.”
All*pn you beasts of the field, come to devour— all*ld you beasts in the forest.
His*ln watchmen are blind; they*ld are all without knowledge; they*ln are all silent dogs; they*ld cannot bark, dreaming,*ln lying down, loving*ld to slumber.
The*ln dogs have a mighty appetite; they*ld never have enough. But*ln they are shepherds who have no understanding; they*ld have all turned to their own way, each*ld to his own gain, one and all.
“Come,”*ln they say, “let me get wine; let*ld us fill ourselves with strong drink; and*ln tomorrow will be like this day, great*ld beyond measure.”
